CatDescriptText: R. Murray, musician, Dinwiddie Street, Republican and Isom Bell, 2158 Centre Avenue, Democrat, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 9, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Whom do you think the Democratic and the Republican parties will choose for their respective presidential candidates? Why?" Mr. Murray's answer reads: "Public opinion seems to say that the Democratic nomination will be Kennedy.  And Nixon seems to be backed by the majority of the masses for the Republican nomination."  Mr. Bell's answer reads: "Johnson appears to be the Democratic choice, because he has more prestige than the others.  And Nixon probably will be the Republican candidate."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of R. Murray wearing plaid shirt and cap, standing in front of store window with stop smoking sign; Portrait of Isom Bell wearing diagonal striped suit jacket and hat, standing in front of three men and building
